title: So your layer-2 is 'secured by Ethereum' — what does that mean? - Blockworks
summary:
Layer-2 blockchains built on Ethereum offer increased security, speed, and lower costs for transactions. However, the term "secured by Ethereum" can be interpreted in different ways, and there are various approaches to achieving this security.

The main selling point of layer-2s is their ability to increase throughput while maintaining the security of Ethereum. This means that users can transact faster and cheaper without sacrificing the security of their assets.

There are four main types of layer-2s, each with its own trade-offs:

1. zkRollups: These use validity proofs with data on L1 Ethereum, providing a secure and efficient way to roll up transactions.
2. Optimistic Rollups: These use fraud proofs with data on L1 Ethereum, allowing for faster and cheaper transactions while maintaining security.
3. Validium: This type uses validity proofs with data kept off-chain, providing an alternative to zkRollups.
4. Plasma: This type also uses fraud proofs with data kept off-chain, but with a different implementation than Optimistic Rollups.

title: Ethereum Name Service plans expansion to Layer 2 ecosystem - The Block
summary: Ethereum Name Service (ENS) plans to expand its domain name system to Layer 2 ecosystem, allowing for improved scalability and reduced costs. The team will implement Layer 2 interoperability with ENS domains through off-chain resolvers and partnerships with service providers such as Coinbase-operated project cb.id and OptiNames. Additionally, web-integrated domain name TLDs will be integrated with ENS for gasless registration, and DNS names will be tradable as NFTs on the Ethereum blockchain. These developments aim to make ENS names the standard for decentralized digital identity in Web3 and simplify onboarding for traditional internet users.

title: Why Ethereum, Shiba Inu, and Bitcoin Cash Are Rising Today - The Motley Fool
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Cryptocurrencies are rising today due to increased interest from mainstream financial institutions. BlackRock's filing for a spot Bitcoin ETF has sparked a rally, with other players proposing similar ETFs. Bitcoin Cash is particularly popular due to expectations it will be classified as a commodity, not a security. Regulatory clarity is seen as crucial for crypto's growth, with a new law in the UK formally recognizing cryptocurrencies as a regulated financial instrument.

title: Ethereum founder says crypto is on the cusp of a ‘broadband moment’ - Fortune
summary: Ethereum founder Joe Lubin believes that the recent challenges faced by the crypto industry, including the collapse of FTX, are a necessary cleansing process that will pave the way for a new breakthrough. Lubin argues that the demise of centralized crypto services has helped true crypto companies focus and rebuild, setting the stage for a "broadband moment" similar to the widespread adoption of the internet. He suggests that wallets are the area to watch right now, with companies like Coinbase building "wallet as a service" tools to make it easier for firms to integrate crypto into their operations. Lubin's optimism is echoed by venture capitalist Chris Dixon, who believes that crypto is on the cusp of another big leap forward. However, some skeptics argue that the crypto industry needs to focus more on ensuring that people stop getting robbed, rather than pursuing utopian visions of Web3.

title: Celsius granted court approval to convert altcoins into Bitcoin and Ethereum - CryptoSlate
summary: Celsius Network, a bankrupt crypto lender, has been granted court approval to convert its altcoins into Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) effective tomorrow, July 1. The court filing states that Celsius may sell or convert non-BTC and non-ETH cryptocurrencies to BTC or ETH starting from July 1. The firm has been instructed to use commercially reasonable efforts to maximize the value of the altcoins and submit a monthly budget and coin report showing the number of altcoins converted to BTC and ETH. Celsius holds a substantial amount of altcoins worth $187.04 million, including assets such as BNB, Celsius, MATIC, FTT, AVAX, and others. The lender also holds $409.03 million worth of BTC and ETH.

title: Ethereum Price Holds Strong at $1,800 – A Strong Case for Upside - NewsBTC
summary:

However, if it fails to break $1,875 or $1,880, it could decline to $1,860 and potentially lower. Technical indicators are bullish, but a break below $1,820 could lead to further losses.

title: Cardano's Hoskinson Takes Jab at Ethereum Staking - U.Today
summary: Cardano's Hoskinson criticizes Ethereum's staking mechanism, claiming that all of Cardano's ADA is staked, implying a correctly designed proof-of-stake protocol. Hoskinson's comments come after Buterin admitted that staking Ether is complex and requires making associated keys public, raising safety concerns. This is the latest in a series of criticisms from Hoskinson, who has predicted that Ethereum could lose popularity and potentially migrate to Cardano.

title: Ethereum Founder Feels Sorry For Solana; Here's Why - CoinGape
summary: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin expressed sympathy for Solana after the US SEC categorized it as a security in a recent lawsuit. Buterin believes that Ethereum should not "win" by being the only crypto chain left on exchanges, as it would not be an honorable victory. He also stated that Ethereum's real competition is not with other blockchains in the crypto industry but rather with centralized systems expanding rapidly. Solana saw a huge price recovery after being labeled as a security, with its price spiking by 15% on Friday.

title: Whales Move Over $1,282,800,000 in Bitcoin, Ethereum and Dogecoin – Here’s Where the Crypto Is Headed - The Daily Hodl

Other notable transfers include $120M in Dogecoin and $70M in Ethereum. Investors should do their own research and understand risks before investing in cryptocurrencies.

title: Ethereum Founder Vitalik Buterin Says He Feels 'Bad' for Solana - Decrypt
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, expressed concerns about the US regulatory crackdown on crypto projects, including Solana. He feels bad that Solana and other projects are being targeted, as they don't deserve it. Buterin believes that real competition isn't with other blockchains, but with the rapidly expanding centralized world that is imposing itself on the industry. The SEC has launched lawsuits against major exchanges, including Coinbase, Binance, and Kraken, over selling unregistered securities. Solana, along with other cryptocurrencies, has been labeled as unregistered securities in the SEC's complaint against Binance.

title: Layer 3 super public chain, creating a new paradigm of digital economy - Yahoo Finance
summary: Layer 3, a new public chain, aims to solve Ethereum's congestion problem by providing a cross-chain scaling solution. The Layer 3 super public chain will link every blockchain and build an open, transparent, inclusive, fast, and secure decentralized world. It combines cross-chain technology with Layer 1 and Layer 2 expansion solutions to enable faster transaction completion with lower gas fees. The Layer 3 public chain's original series of core technologies will create a cross-chain ecosystem that integrates public chains, wallets, decentralized transactions, decentralized applications, and other layers to serve various fields such as finance, artificial intelligence, and metaverse. The Layer 3 solution has been tested to be the most secure and widely used scaling solution for Ethereum.

title: Ethereum Cancun Upgrade: ETH price to Reach $3000 soon? - CryptoTicker.io - Bitcoin Price, Ethereum Price & Crypto News
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum is preparing for a significant upgrade called Cancun, which will enhance scalability, security, and usability. This upgrade could propel Ethereum's price to $3000. The upgrade includes Proto-Danksharding, which will reduce rollup gas fees, and other Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) such as EIP-4758, 6046, 6190, EIP-5920, and EIP-1153. The Cancun upgrade could attract more users and developers to the Ethereum ecosystem, increasing demand for ETH and potentially driving its price towards $3000. However, investors should consider the risks and volatility associated with cryptocurrency investments.

title: Ethereum transactions frozen for 12 seconds - Blockworks
summary: Ethereum transactions were frozen for 12 seconds as a group of researchers demonstrated a new way to exploit the proposer-builder separation (PBS) feature to censor transactions. The group, known as the Special Mechanisms Group (SMG), showed that by bidding on priority fees, they could force a block to include only one transaction, which was a URL to their research paper. Reactions to the experiment were mixed, with some noting that the gas fee market would make it difficult to delay transactions for long. The SMG group argues that censorship-resistance is not just about ensuring transactions get on-chain eventually, but also about making it fast. They suggest that layer-2 solutions may not be able to solve all problems and that enshrined PBS, or ePBS, could be a solution to make on-chain auctions and other mechanisms more censorship-resistant.

title: Vitalik Buterin stakes only a modest portion of Ethereum, here's why - CryptoSlate
summary: Vitalik Buterin stakes only a small portion of his Ethereum due to security concerns and the complexity of staking safely. He explained that staking requires multi-sig, which is still a tricky process, and rare, unpredictable events can also influence his decision. However, some experts argue that continued Ethereum innovation may make it possible to overcome these challenges and increase staking adoption.

title: Solana (SOL) Outshines Ethereum in This Key Metric: Details - U.Today
summary: Solana (SOL) has surpassed Ethereum in 24-hour NFT trading volume, with $25.5 million in volume compared to $24.5 million for Ethereum. This is the first time Solana has beaten Ethereum in this metric. Despite this, Ethereum still dominates in terms of total value locked ($26.7 billion vs. $265.57 million for Solana) and market capitalization ($231.17 billion vs. $7.38 billion). Both are PoS blockchains, but Solana was designed for this consensus model from the start, while Ethereum transitioned from PoW through the Merge.

title: Ethereum's Vitalik Buterin Feels Bad for Solana (SOL), Here's Why - U.Today
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, expressed empathy towards Solana (SOL) and other projects facing regulatory challenges. He believes that Ethereum's success should not come at the expense of other projects being pushed off exchanges due to security concerns. Buterin views the real competition as the centralized world imposing itself on the blockchain and crypto space, and suggests that the industry should stand together to face these threats.

title: CME Group to Launch Ethereum-to-Bitcoin Ratio Futures Next Month - Yahoo Finance
summary: CME Group to launch Ethereum-to-Bitcoin ratio futures contract on July 31, pending regulatory approval. The contract will allow investors to speculate on or hedge against the relative performance of Ethereum and Bitcoin. This is the second time CME is launching crypto futures, after the successful launch of Bitcoin futures in 2017. The move is seen as a way to provide institutional investors with a regulated platform to trade cryptocurrencies and potentially increase liquidity in the market.

title: News Explorer — Ethereum Name Service Working to Support Layer-2 Networks - Decrypt
summary: Ethereum Name Service (ENS) is working to support layer-2 networks, aiming to improve scalability and reduce costs for domain name registrations and transactions. This upgrade will make domain name registrations more accessible to a wider user base.

title: Why Are People Burning CryptoPunks for Ordinals NFTs? - nft now
summary: People are burning their CryptoPunks and transferring them to the Bitcoin blockchain as Ordinals, a new NFT collection, in order to take advantage of their value and to make a statement about the potential of the Bitcoin ecosystem. The Ordinal Maxi Biz project, led by Bitcoin Bandits, is offering allowlist spots for CryptoPunk holders who burn their NFTs and inscribe them on the Bitcoin blockchain. The project aims to emphasize the potential of the Bitcoin ecosystem for innovation in the NFT space and to shake up cultural lines between the two ecosystems. The move has raised concerns among some members of the CryptoPunks community, who see it as a loss of cultural and historical significance.

title: SHIB, BTC, ETH Can Now Be Used to Book 600 Airlines via This Partnership - U.Today
summary: Binance Pay, a cryptocurrency payment technology by Binance, now accepts over 600 airlines for flight bookings through its partnership with Alternative Airlines. Users can pay with Shiba Inu, Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrencies to get a 3% discount on flights. This partnership expands Binance Pay's supported cryptocurrencies to over 70 options. Recently, Shiba Inu listed on SBI VC Trade, a cryptocurrency exchange subsidiary of SBI, a Tokyo-based financial holding company, and BITPoint, Japan's first top exchange, reaffirmed its support for Shiba Inu. As of now, SHIB is marginally down to $0.0000075, with 1,653,845,435 tokens burned in June and 3,894,189 tokens burned in the past 24 hours through three transactions.

title: Mastercard Working On Ethereum-Based Multi-token Network - CryptoDaily
summary: Mastercard is launching a blockchain-based marketplace for financial applications, called the Mastercard Multi Token Network (MTN). The platform will offer a range of tools and resources for developers to create regulated financial applications, including a private Ethereum-based blockchain and tokenized commercial bank deposits. Mastercard's goal is to provide a secure, scalable, and interoperable infrastructure for transactions within the digital asset and blockchain ecosystems, with the potential to transform the global economy. The company believes that the current trajectory of digital asset and blockchain technologies is similar to the internet's growth arc, and that they will become critical infrastructure for storing and moving value. The launch of the MTN represents a major shift towards the adoption of crypto technology in the financial industry, showcasing Mastercard's commitment to promoting a wider range of secure, accessible, and always-on payment solutions.

title: Coinbase layer-2 network Base closes in on mainnet launch - Cointelegraph
summary: Coinbase's layer-2 network, Base, is nearing mainnet launch after completing six months of rigorous security audits. The network, powered by Optimism, has fulfilled ⅘ of the criteria required for launch, including a successful infrastructure review and a public smart contract audit. Base has also developed an open-source monitoring tool, Pessimism, to notify builders of any anomalies in the protocol. The final criteria to be fulfilled is demonstrating testnet stability, and the team is reviewing submissions from 100 security researchers who participated in the public audit. Base aims to become a secure and developer-friendly network for building decentralized applications.

title: ETF winners and losers in 2023: Global X's 21 shares ethereum ETF, FANG+ ETF - The Australian Financial Review
summary: Global X's 21 shares ethereum ETF and FANG+ ETF were the top performers in 2023, with returns of 39.6% and 42%, respectively. In contrast, Global X's ultra-short Nasdaq 100 hedge fund, Betashares' crude oil, currency hedged synthetic ETF, and the Global X physical palladium ETF were the worst performers, with returns of -70.36%, -38.31%, and -27.34%, respectively. The performance of these ETFs in 2023 was opposite to their performance in 2022, when the losers were among the top performers. Investors are shifting their attention to potential revenue opportunities in AI, leading to a change in market sentiment for mega-cap tech stocks.

title: The resurgence of Bitcoin's dominance - The News Minute
summary: Bitcoin's dominance may reach 52-53% in the short term, with a target of 56-60% by year-end. Altcoins may lose 20-40% in value against BTC. Investors should stick to BTC and ETH for most of their crypto portfolio.

title: Ethereum Dencun upgrade coming; Can it send ETH to $5,000? - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary: Ethereum is set to undergo a major upgrade called Dencun in late 2023, which could lead to increased scalability, storage, and gas efficiency. The upgrade includes two major components: Cancun (execution layer) and Deneb (consensus layer). The upgrade could potentially send ETH prices soaring to $5,000 by the end of the year, according to historical price chart patterns. However, the price could also remain in the $1,880 area if a more bearish pattern reoccurs.

The Ethereum supply of Ether tanked, reaching an all-time low, while the ETH price gained 4.6% in the past 24 hours.
